intro: Rebis, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its dark green, waxy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces a toxic sap that contains various alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. Rebis typically grows in woodland areas and along stream banks, preferring moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it both a notable ornamental plant and a species requiring careful handling due to its toxicity.
